newsitem.title: SPAIN: Madrid stocks close lower after 50 bp key rate cut.
newsitem.headline: Madrid stocks close lower after 50 bp key rate cut.

text.p: Madrid stocks closed lower on Thursday after the Bank of Spain cut its key money rate 50 basis points to 6.75 percent, as most had expected.
The losses were interpreted as much-needed consolidation and most continue to expect the bourse to test new highs soon.
Caution may well set the tone on Friday however, with all eyes on the release of September U.S. non-farm payroll.
The general index fell 1.35 points, 0.36 percent to 370.48 and the Ibex shed 18.53 points, 0.43 percent to 4,243.86.
Hypermarket Pryca fell 110 pesetas to 3,000 after it said on Wednesday that gross sales to September fell 0.3 percent.

The key rate cut had been widely anticipated, setting off profit-taking after various sessions of highs. But the bourse has further to go on prospects for more monetary easing this year, dealers said.
"The market has all the ingredients to go up again, but it might take a certain time," said one trader.
Volume, boosted by non-resident investors, totalled 33 billion pesetas.
